name: Classic Sociological Theory I
description: The development of classic sociological theory from its Enlightenment origins to the eve of the 20th century. Special emphasis is placed on the work of Adam Smith, Karl Marx, Alexis de Tocqueville, and Auguste Comte. Special tutorials are devoted to learning the craft of effective writing.
prerequisites: [[(SOCA01H3) and (SOCA02H3)] or SOCA03Y3] and enrolment in a Sociology program
